hook.text: In 1945, most of Africa and Asia were colonies. By 1975, nearly all were independent. Empire ended in a generation.

buildup.text: World War II weakened European empires. Colonies that fought for freedom abroad demanded their own.

discovery.text: India gained independence in 1947 through mass nonviolent resistance. It inspired movements across the globe.

twist.text: Many new nations inherited borders, debts, and institutions designed for colonial extraction, not self-rule.

climax.text: Neocolonialism replaced direct rule. Former powers kept economic control through trade deals and debt.

punchline.text: Flags changed. Power structures often didn't. Independence was just the start.

quiz.question: What is neocolonialism?
options: Former colonial powers maintaining economic control through trade and debt
A movement to restore colonial empires
A form of direct military occupation
